input: In the main video on cryptocurrencies, I made two references to situations where in order to break a given piece of security, you would have to guess a specific string of 256 bits.
from_community_srt: U glavnom videu o digitalnom novcu, dva puta sam se pozivao na okolnosti gdje, da biste razbili dani dio sigurnosti trebali biste pogoditi poseban jedinstveni niz od 256 bita(1 ili 0).

input: One of these was in the context of digital signatures, and the other in the context of a cryptographic hash function.
from_community_srt: Jedna od tih okolnosti je u suznačju sa digitalnim potpisima a druga u suznačju sa funkcijom

input: For example, if you want to find a message whose SHA-256 hash is some specific string of 256 bits, you have no better method than to just guess and check random messages.
from_community_srt: kriptografskog otiska.Na primjer, ako želite naći zapis čiji je SHA-256 hash(otisak) neki određeni skup znakova od 256 bitova, nemate bolje metode od jednostavnog pogađanja i provjere nasumičnih zapisa,

input: This would require, on average, 2 to the 256 guesses.
from_community_srt: a to bi tražilo u prosjeku 2^256 pokušaja.

input: This is a number so far removed from anything we ever deal with that it can be hard to appreciate its size, but let's give it a try.
from_community_srt: Sada, taj je broj toliko jako udaljen od bilo čega s čime mi imamo posla da bi bilo teško razumjeti njegovu vrijednost.

input: Two to the 256 is the same as 2 to the 32 multiplied by itself 8 times.
from_community_srt: Ali barem pokušajmo. 2^256 to je isto kao 2^32, pomnožen sam sa sobom osam puta.

input: What's nice about that split is that 2 to the 32 is 4 billion, which is at least a number we can think about.
from_community_srt: Sad ono što je lijepo u vezi ove usporedbe je to da 2^32 iznosi četiri milijarde.Što predstavlja broj čiju vrijednost možemo zamisliti,

input: All we need to do is appreciate what multiplying 4 billion times itself 8 successive times really feels like.
from_community_srt: zar ne?To je jedan od pojmova koje možemo vidjeti u nekom naslovu. Znači trebamo vrednovati kakav je to osjećaj množiti 4 milijarde same sa sobom osam uzastopnih puteva.

input: As many of you know, the GPU on your computer can let you run a bunch of computations in parallel incredibly quickly.
from_community_srt: Kako mnogi od vas znaju grafički procesor vašeg računala dozvoljava vam izvesti cijeli niz istovremenih operacija nevjerovatno brzo.

input: If you were to specially program a GPU to run a cryptographic hash function over and over, a really good one might be able to do a little less than a billion hashes per second.
from_community_srt: Znači kad biste vi posebno programirali GPU da pokrene kriptografsku hash funkciju mnogo puta, jedan doista dobar bio bi u stanju izraditi nešto manje od milijardu hasheva u sekundi.

input: Let's say you just take a bunch of those and cram your computer full of extra GPUs so that your computer can run 4 billion hashes per second.
from_community_srt: Recimo da vi uzmete nekolicinu njih i natrpate vaše računalo dodatnim GPU-ima tako da vaše računalo može izvoditi 4 milijarde hasheva u sekundi.

input: So the first 4 billion here is going to represent the number of hashes per second per computer.
from_community_srt: Dakle prvih 4 milijarde predstavljat će broj hasheva u sekundi po računalu.

input: Now, picture 4 billion of these GPU-packed computers.
from_community_srt: Sada, zamislite 4 milijarde takvih računala.

input: For comparison, even though Google does not at all make their number of servers public, estimates have it somewhere in the single-digit millions.
from_community_srt: Radi usporedbe, iako Google ne iznosi u javnost broj svojih servera, procjenjuje se da ih ima otprilike jednoznamenkasti broj milijuna.

input: In reality, most of those servers are going to be much less powerful than our imagined GPU-packed machine.
from_community_srt: U stvarnosti, većina tih servera je puno slabija od našeg zamišljenog računala popunjenog GPU-ima.

input: But let's say that Google replaced all of its millions of servers with a machine like this, then 4 billion machines would mean about 1,000 copies of this souped-up Google.
from_community_srt: No zamislimo da je Google zamijenio sve svoje milijune servera sa računalom poput ovoga. Tada bi 4 milijarde računala značilo oko 1000 kopija ovog ojačanog Google-a.

input: Let's call that 1 kilo-Google worth of computing power.
from_community_srt: Nazovimo to jedan  kilo-google vrijednosti računalne snage.

input: There's about 7.3 billion people on Earth.
So next, imagine giving a little over half of every individual on Earth their own personal kilo-Google.
from_community_srt: Na zemlji ima 7.3  milijarde ljudi, dakle slijedeće zamislite da dajete nešto više od polovici pojedinaca na Zemlji njihov osobni KiloGoogle.

input: Now, imagine 4 billion copies of this Earth.
from_community_srt: Sada, zamislite 4 milijarde kopija ove Zemlje.

input: For comparison, the Milky Way has somewhere between 100 and 400 billion stars.
from_community_srt: Radi usporedbe, mliječna staza ima otprilike između 100 i 400 milijardi zvijezda.

input: We don't really know, but the estimates tend to be in that range.
from_community_srt: Mi zapravo ne znamo, ali procjene teže tom okviru.

input: This would be akin to a full 1% of every star in the galaxy having a copy of Earth where half the people on Earth have their own personal kilo-Google.
from_community_srt: To bi bilo nešto kao da cijelih 1% svih zvijezda u galaksiji, ima kopiju Zemlje, pri čemu jedna polovica ljudi na toj Zemlji ima svoj vlastiti osobni KiloGoogle.

input: Next, try to imagine 4 billion copies of the Milky Way.
from_community_srt: Pokušajte, zatim, zamisliti 4 milijarde kopija Mliječne staze.

input: And we're going to call this your giga-galactic supercomputer, running about 2 to the 160 guesses every second.
from_community_srt: I sad ćemo to nazvati vašim giga galaktičkim super-računalom,

input: Now, 4 billion seconds, that's about 126.8 years.
from_community_srt: na kojem se pokreće 2^160 pogađanja svake sekunde.Sada 4 milijarde sekundi? To je otprilike 126.8 godina.

input: Four billion of those, well that's 507 billion years, which is about 37 times the age of the universe.
from_community_srt: 4 milijarde toga? Pa, to je 507 milijardi godina, što je 37 puta više od starosti svemira.

input: So even if you were to have your GPU-packed kilo-Google-per-person multiplanetary giga-galactic computer guessing numbers for 37 times the age of the universe, it would still only have a 1 in 4 billion chance of finding the correct guess.
from_community_srt: Dakle da ste čak i imali vaš nabildani kilo google po osobi umnožen u multiplanetarno giga galaktičko računalo koje pogađa brojeve 37 puta duže od starosti svemira, i dalje bi imao jedan naprema četiri milijarde šansi da pronađe točnu kombinaciju.

input: By the way, the state of Bitcoin hashing these days is that all of the miners put together guess and check at a rate of about 5 billion billion hashes per second.
from_community_srt: Usput, stanje sa bitcoinovim hashingom u današnje vrijeme je tako da takozvani rudari postavljaju pogađanje i provjeru na razinu od otprilike pet milijardi milijarda hasheva u sekundi.

input: That corresponds to one third of what I just described as a kilo-Google.
from_community_srt: To odgovara otprilike jednoj trećini od onoga što sam maloprije opisao kao Kilogoogle.

input: This is not because there are billions of GPU-packed machines out there, but because miners actually use something that's about 1000 times better than a GPU, application-specific integrated circuits.
from_community_srt: To nije zbog toga što zapravo postoje milijarde takvih strojeva u svijetu, nego zbog toga što rudari bitcoina zapravo koriste nešto što je otprilike tisuću puta bolje od

input: These are pieces of hardware specifically designed for Bitcoin mining, for running a bunch of SHA-256 hashes, and nothing else.
from_community_srt: Integriranih krugova posebno namijenjenih za GPU.To su dijelovi hardvera posebno namjenjeni za rudarenje bitcoina, za pokretanje gomile SHA-256 hasheva i ničeg drugog.

input: Turns out, there's a lot of efficiency gains to be had when you throw out the need for general computation and design your integrated circuits for one and only one task.
from_community_srt: Proizlazi, da dobivate puno na efikasnosti kad odbacite potrebu za općenitim računanjem i osmislite vaše integrirane krugove za jednu i samo jednu zadaću.

input: Also, on the topic of large powers of two that I personally find it hard to get my mind around, this channel recently surpassed 2 to the 18th subscribers.
from_community_srt: Također, na temu visokih potencija broja 2 koju sam osobno doživio teškom za shvatiti, ovaj kanal je nedavno prešao 2^18 pretplatnika,

input: And to engage a little more with some sub-portion of those 2 to the 18 people, I'm going to do a Q&A session.
from_community_srt: i ako se uključi još koji broj neke manje vrijednosti od 2^18 ljudi, pokrenut ću poseban dio "pitanja i odgovora".

input: I've left a link in the description to a Reddit thread where you can post questions and upvote the ones you want to hear answers to. And probably in the next video or on Twitter or something like that I'll announce the format in which I'd like to give answers. See you then!
from_community_srt: Ostavio sam vezu u opisu videozapisa na "Reddit" diskusiju, gdje možete postavljati pitanja i doznati odgovore I vjerojatno ću u sljedećem videu na twitteru ili nečem sličnom, najaviti oblik u kojem želim napisati odgovore. Doviđenja do tada.
